review: Bought this when AMAZON.com dropped price from $35 to $32 one day for a brief time. I currently own and use several ROKU units and 1 APPLE TV (current generations of each media player). I was intrigued and wanted to see what all the hype was about. When it arrived I installed the unit on a new 40 inch TV.The unit booted up immediately and the screen said to log onto GOOGLE.com/CHROMECAST/SETUP. The display showed the number for my Chromecast unit.This cannot be done. First you must download and install the Google CHROME browser for either your MS-DOS or OS X operating system. OK minor hurtle but deceptive. Then you must link that to both your WiFi network and your device that you will use as your streaming source. Not necessarily easy to do either. It is certainly not plug and play if you not currently using Chrome.Bottom line: For a few bucks more, get a ROKU or APPLE TV ... easier to install ... more viewing choices ..and you are not saddled with a browser you may not want. (Better yet: read a book and/or write a real letter on paper and mail it!)Google is beginning to remind me of Bill Gates/MS in the 1980's when they clearly wanted to take over the entire PC environment. I installed and used successfully every MS-DOS alternative to avoid MS. Each of them was more stable and user-friendly than Gates & CO.Remember we are always better off with free choice and not a monopoly.
